page.title: 17Ecology of Yewdale 3
page.content: The{fox, badger, red squirrel, {brown hare, roe}and{red deer}are all found in Yewdale, but recently there have been unwelcome additions such as the{mink.}Fortunately,{grey squirrels have yet to penetrate into this area. On the fells the{raven}and{buzzard are still much in evidence, with the {meadow pipit}and{wheatear}amongst the commonest of the smaller birds. The woods attract the{pied flycatcher, {redstart, tree pipit}and{chiffchaff, with young conifers a suitable habitat for{titmice}and{goldcrests. Along the becks the{dipper}and{grey {wagtail}flourish, with{yellow wagtails and{ducks}in the lower reaches. Many of these waters contain{brown trout, with the usual range of smaller fish, {minnows, bullheads}and{sticklebacks. Some becks are devoid of life because of pollution from copper mining.
